content.1: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
content.2: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for
content.3: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
content.5: That the triumphing of the wicked
content.6: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;
content.8: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
content.10: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.
content.12: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth,
content.15: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.
content.16: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper’s tongue shall slay him.
content.17: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.
content.18: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow
content.20: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.
content.21: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.
content.22: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.
content.24: He shall flee from the iron weapon,
content.25: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors
content.27: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.
content.28: The increase of his house shall depart,
